reviews.text: I wouldn't consider this famous lake to be outstandingly beautiful, however it's worth visiting for its cultural and historical importance. Nevertheless, it being a very popular spot for bicycling, I was highly disappointed to discover that most of the roads around the lake are closed to cyclists, including the famous causeways that run across the lake.

One of the major tourist attractions in Hangzhou and a great spot to relax, stroll, ride the boat and enjoy the scenic view of the lake and massive natural surroundings. Make sure you avoid China’s public holidays to come here in order to avoid huge crowds and too many hassles.

The view of the lake was beautiful and I loved the ambient, the walk was so relaxing. I wish I had more time here so I could see the entire lake and its surroundings. I'll definitely come back this summer.

Great place to escape if you want to get away from the smog of the other big cities. Nice views, peaceful walks, boat rides and tea houses. 
The river and the surroundings are very clean. You wouldn't think it's China if you take out the people. 
Every day there is a light show(fountain of light) 7pm and 8pm. 
We visited in early spring the lotus flowers have not come up yet.
The lake is closer to the city.

Definitely enjoy the boat ride on the West Lake. The beauty of Hangzhou's willow draped islands. The boat ride is slow so you can enjoy the breeze, very relaxing & peaceful. The view is gorgeous! The sunset view is amazing~

There is a park/garden near by, nice to sit back & relax after a busy schedule touring in Hangzhou.

I wouldn't consider this famous lake to be outstandingly beautiful, however it's worth visiting for its cultural and historical importance. Nevertheless, it being a very popular spot for bicycling, I was highly disappointed to discover that most of the roads around the lake are closed to cyclists, including the famous causeways that run across the lake.

One of the major tourist attractions in Hangzhou and a great spot to relax, stroll, ride the boat and enjoy the scenic view of the lake and massive natural surroundings. Make sure you avoid China’s public holidays to come here in order to avoid huge crowds and too many hassles.

The view of the lake was beautiful and I loved the ambient, the walk was so relaxing. I wish I had more time here so I could see the entire lake and its surroundings. I'll definitely come back this summer.

Great place to escape if you want to get away from the smog of the other big cities. Nice views, peaceful walks, boat rides and tea houses. 
The river and the surroundings are very clean. You wouldn't think it's China if you take out the people. 
Every day there is a light show(fountain of light) 7pm and 8pm. 
We visited in early spring the lotus flowers have not come up yet.
The lake is closer to the city.

Definitely enjoy the boat ride on the West Lake. The beauty of Hangzhou's willow draped islands. The boat ride is slow so you can enjoy the breeze, very relaxing & peaceful. The view is gorgeous! The sunset view is amazing~

There is a park/garden near by, nice to sit back & relax after a busy schedule touring in Hangzhou.
Reasonable price. Nice spot to chill or walk. Beautiful and clean.
Great little quiet spot we stumbled upon. It's 15 RMB to enter and you're free to walk around and explore.
It worths 15 RMB
Nice. Historical place during the turbulent 5 dynasty era.
門票15元，可逛很久，不錯的地方。20181026
nice place with lots of choices for food. I was able to grab my mother tea set while I was there. There were men roasting tea, lots of other souvenirs available. Very interesting place.
妈妈很喜欢去吴山广场跳舞，锻炼身体非常好，吹着微风听着歌，多惬意
不错，有很多好玩的小玩意在卖
挺大的广场，旁边就是清河坊。吃东西很方便。
来散步的话还可以，从河坊街出来之后可以去商业街。
Absolutely worth to visit stunning view and amazing interaction between ancient, modern city on the background and nature.
Absolutely lovely place for a walk, West lake offers a beautiful view, and the Park are lovely aswell. I'd suggest buying a fan though, it gets very warm in all of Hangzhou during summertime.

Amazing hiking, Day hikes are amazing... once u clear the bulk of people by the pagoda.... it is quite and serene
I come for the light day hike everytime im in Hangzhou
Nice place
unmissable

You know how people always say don't take the elevator up the Efifel Tower because you'll miss the most iconic tower? This is the same logic, skip Leifeng Pagoda, instead head for Jingci Temple. You get a pretty good view of the Pagoda.
Oh and did I mention that the tickets are like a tenth of Leifeng Pagoda?
This area is so expansive and beautiful it is worth a 20 miles hike around this ancient temple

淨慈寺，又稱淨慈報恩光孝禪寺，位於浙江杭州西湖湖畔南屏山，漢族地區佛教全國重點寺院之一。

淨慈寺初為「慧日永明院」，為五代十國後周顯德元年（954年）吳越國王錢弘俶為永明延壽禪師所建。北宋改為壽寧禪院，南宋又為淨慈報恩光孝禪寺，簡稱淨慈寺或淨慈禪寺。被列為禪宗五山之一。明、清以後屢毀屢建。

淨慈寺為典型漢傳佛教寺廟風格。大雄寶殿西例有濟祖殿，殿前有運木古井一口，殿內供奉濟公禪師像。在淨慈寺門右邊有「南屏晚鐘」碑亭，為杭州著名的西湖十景之一。

明太祖洪武年間，鑄一座巨鐘，每日傍晚，夕陽西下，暝色蒼茫，鐘聲在群山碧空中迴蕩，響徹雲霄。由於南屏山空穴怪石較多，鐘聲經石穴迴蕩互激，鐘聲傳播到十多里外。康熙皇帝也在淨慈寺寺門外建碑亭，上刻「南屏晚鐘」四字。清朝末年，銅鐘在戰亂中消失。1984年，淨慈寺在日本曹洞宗大本山永平寺相助下，重建大梵鍾。1986年11月21日，中日佛教界人士數百人歡聚淨慈寺，舉行了隆重的大梵鍾落成法會。

在淨慈寺後院，還保存著宋代高僧如淨禪師墓塔。
殊勝 莊嚴
風景優美，豆腐乾&素鵝很好吃。

The place is spectacular!! The temple is huge and there are lots to see and learn. 飞来峰 is on the way to the temple and there are loads of magnificent stone statues along the way. Quite a bit of walking needed but it was totally worth it.. do visit every single temple around the area, every temple has a different story and different things to see and explore.. I would recommend this if anyone is visiting hangzhou.. thumbs up
Beautiful and unique with it's 500 monks bronze statues chamber. The rest of the resort has a few more very impressive temples.

A must-visit place if you travel to Hangzhou.
It's hard to tell other people how you feel about a pagoda, a soul visit not a travel one.
I treasured the moment of visiting Lingyin pagoda
Beautifully maintained and very interesting. The gardens are magnificent

Very crowded temple with bad traffic on the way. You will be charged twice to get into the temple. If you are not a believer, you can just pay a 45 RMB entrance fee and enjoy the beautiful creek and hills in there.
Amazing historic place. Beautiful statues.

Excellent. Must go if in Xihu tourist zone. Within same park as Lin Yin Temple. Read from other reviews in the difficulties to get a taxi when leaving the place. However, seems this is due to peak season traveling. When there in mid January. Taxis were plenty. 

We made a mistake in this case due to fear of not getting a taxi to book one for 5 hours at CNY300 which I think we might be overcharged. But not too bad though, cos the driver also drove us to a local restaurant for a cheap lunch, Long Jing Village and Liu He Pagoda before returning to our hotel.
愛登山的朋友不能錯過，山上物資缺乏，礦泉水很貴。可以盡量輕裝上山
適度的距離與不算難走的山路，可以見到鑲嵌在石壁上的古佛相。

Входной билет 45 юаней. Очень интересное место. Удивительно сохранившиеся до наших дней статуи. Везде аккуратные дорожки. Магазины с водой и едой. За дополнительную  плату  можно посетить моностырь.   Если пройти дальше , можно попасть в целый комплекс храмов , откуда открывается вид на город
A historical mosque, one of the oldest mosque in China. Too bad the toilets are not too clean

Mosque with several Centuries history. Ancient Architecture well preserved. Halal restaurant available near by - exit the main gate, turn left and turn left again, walk along the street to find the restaurant on your left.
It is a historical Muslim Mosque of Hangzhou. Many internationals gather here for Juma prayer. Many halal meat shops nearby.
Interesting place to visit.

SA
I will visit Muslim Mosque Inshaallah and share my feelings, pictures adn info.
I won’t pay that entrance fee for such a small place, everything what’s around is amazing and don’t need a entrance fee! So DONT FALL IN A TRAP!;)
Nice place for a stroll. Pack a picnic to thoroughly enjoy the peaceful ambiance.  10RMB entry.
私人庭院門票10塊錢
郭莊在西湖西側，楊公堤中。進得園內，尤如一隻大盆景。美景如畫，無以復加。可以說，每一個位置，每一個角度，都是一幅絕妙圖畫。
徽派建筑特色。以前的主人应该是徽商

Last month i was joined this activities. The name of this activity is “beauty run” . The location in xixi wetland national park this place are very beautifull they have many a lot of garden and many kinds of flower in this area. You can enjoy with your friend to make some picnic or look around their nature. So fresh air and their facilities are nice. Don’t worry about the price. I think it’s not expensive to enter this attractions.

A 5A rated natural park with numerous ponds and water channels. It is impossible to enjoy the whole view of this place in one day. Just seat on a boat and sailing between island or under small bridges. This area is well preserved, in spite of its near a huge city.
An okay wetland, you better have a guide to guide you around.
Great wetland park. Best is to tour it on boat.

Pretty cool wetland to visit, however, seems a bit over-priced.

Even though they say it's a natural wetland, I will feel like it's geared towards tourists too much, so the convenience of boat rides, shops, and little restaurants among the wetland area gave me a feeling that it ISN'T so natural. The roads have been paved over the land to make easy access for tourists, and that contradicts the concept of wetland to me. Also, the explanations done by the tour guide on the boat was only available in Chinese, so I assume I missed a lot of important information to get to know this wetland area better. I still like the fact that China is putting consideration in creating wetlands, which are good for species habitat and water.

I wish the tour would involve less civilization and give a chance for more engaging experience of the nature itself.

Sick animals, depressed, sad, poorly treated, dirty, bear had his mouth foamed, the monkey had his eye buckled and no fur, the cages are tiny for the tiger, the leopard and they walk from side to side, totally neurotic, the wolf had thin legs and a look of despair, a place of horror and sadness. Without any respect to animals! China has wonderful places, but definitely this zoo is a shame!! Much sadness...

I absolutely was disgusted!!! 
This is no zoo!! 
Horrendous treatment to the animals. This is animals cruelty.
Needs to be shut down!!!! 
Tiger with speal need tortured!!!

We really enjoyed our time in Hangzhou zoo
Very clean, very cute bears and pandas
It's really fun for kids and also for a family trip
You can spend at least two hours inside the zoo without feeling bored cause there are so many things to do and see in this zoo
Don't miss it

This Zoo is the most disgusting zoo I have seen in my life. The animals all look sick and not well taken care of. Forget this place and go check out Hangzhou's Safari Park. Much nicer and better conditions.

Nice place, but there are few animals.
Ticket price is 20 rmb

Busy restaurant with a good view of the lake. The food is  not bad but not impressive.We ordered the popular menu of fried tofu thin, was good. But the sweet and sour sauce fish is an acquired taste for us. Worth a one time visit not a repeat.

The location is quite good, but the taste was not very good, to tell you the truth. Although it seems this is quite famous and authentic Hangzhou cuisine around here, the food is just oily, not so tasty.
When they held G20, they sever the meal. This will help you to make the story.
Greasy chicken cooked in plastic wrap, oily bland soup, overpriced but has a five star view! Be careful - they will not even call you a taxi at the end of the meal.

With family and wonderful friends
We ate very well
With chopstics....

3 stars for the food, 4 stars for the location and spectacular view. Must visit and eat at this restaurant as first time visitors. You won't get the vast views of the lake from anywhere else. The opulent chandeliers and grand decor makes the vast ambience welcoming for families and tourists. The server presented our "fish" in bucket to ensure it was alive and fresh and not frozen.

Mid segment India n restaurant near to lake area. For Indians it has good options and worth. Price is moderate. I tried this during my  many visits. People are good. Lot of Indians and Pakistanis can been seen here. Places location is great. Need to improve ambience and overall service, quality and taste standards. Wash rooms need refurbishement.

it was terrible. servers are arrogant. they did not give me even a cup of water. whenever i asked them several times, they just stand on chairs and kept their eyes on their phone. it was lunch time on weekdays. they didn't not busy. there was 3 servers and only 3 groups of customers. is it an excessive demand? when he gave me a cup of water, he slammed that. the water splashed on table. but he just went out without any apology for his rudeness.
CLOSED DOWN FOR BUSINESS!
It's closed Permanently. Anyone looking for Indian food, please find another place
food is ok...not completely indian taste....Saturday buffet is goo choice

This recent trip is our family’s second stay at Shangrila Bangkok. The first was awesome, which brought us back for our second. This stay has been comfortable and enjoying for my children, as well as my parents. Friendly and helpful staff at the lobby on our arrival. My 6 year old girl vomited after our taxi ride from the airport. A few female young staff were extremely helpful, quickly handing us towels and helped consoling my girl, and later offered her a drink. These staff were so fast and so helpful! We felt very warm at heart!!! Our balcony rooms were wonderful. And I must highly recommend the breakfast at next2. Superb variety, great food and very attentive service! We will definitely come back!

Thank you for the colleague who did the check in. Even our room booking was under staff rate, she was patient to introduce and solve our problem which was treating us as guest. Very helpful and kind.
Also, the Chi spa was excellent. I went to Thailand and tried different spa for many times. The therapist-Honey in Chi spa was even the best. Her warm smile made me felt welcomed at the beginning and the massage made me felt worth to pay. Thank you for the relaxing experience she gave to me.

This place has been around for a while now, and it's well-known among the locals - for good reason! It's a superb hotel, and the staff members are excellent. Our company reserved the conference hall for a half day and evening for a full company meeting, and everything went really well. The Chinese dinner they served was excellent! (Peking duck - very, very good.)

Really, there are no complaints about this place. It's an added bonus that the hotel is sitting right next to the Chaophraya River, and you can get great views from the hotel bar or even the pool deck.

Would be a great getaway place.

I would have loved to give it a 5 star because of its location and ambience but reducing a star for complexity of navigating between meeting rooms and Building wings. You can't help being lost. Having said that, staff are very helpful and show you the way and you reach your destination walking really long!

The staff were kind, and the food in the lounge was delicious.
Only thing to be improved is cleanliness of the table in the lounge. I could see the traces of the cups left in many places and a little bit sticky when I am touching on surface of the table. It seems they have not wiped the table clean after the customer left.

And the communication skill/ background information about hotel facility should be more improved. We asked if we could borrow ping-pong racket /ball to play table tennis near swimming pool (Depending on each hotel policy, we used to borrow the racket and ball before) however, the staff in Krungthep lobby told us that we have to purchase the racket and ball in Robinson shopping mall whereas we found that racket and ball were equipped beside on the table while taking a walk later.
